Subsection Title: Offering Price of the Secured Notes:** **% plus accrued interest, if any, from** **, 2021. Offering Price of the Unsecured Notes:** **% plus accrued interest, if any, from** **, 2021.
Subsubsection Text: The offer and sale of the Notes has not been and will not be registered under the Securities Act of 1933, as amended (the “Securities Act”), and the Notes are being offered only (1) to persons reasonably believed to be qualified institutional buyers under Rule 144A under the Securities Act and (2) to non-U.S. persons in offshore transactions in compliance with Regulation S under the Securities Act. The Notes may not be offered or sold, except as described above, within the United States or to U.S. persons. For a description of certain information about eligible offerees and restrictions on transfers of the Notes, see “Notice to Investors” and “Plan of Distribution.” The Notes will not be subject to registration rights and will not be listed on any securities exchange. The Notes will be ready for delivery to investors in book entry form through The Depository Trust Company (“DTC”) on or about, 2021. _Joint Book-Running Managers_

Subsection Title: Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC** **BofA Securities** **Barclays Credit Suisse** **Deutsche Bank Securities** **RBC Capital Markets UBS Investment Bank** **Wells Fargo Securities** **HSBC BMO Capital Markets** **BNP PARIBAS** **KKR Mizuho Securities** **MUFG** **Truist Securities
Subsubsection Text: The date of this offering circular is 2021. -----

$1,210,000,000 #### LABL, Inc. $750,000,000 % Senior Secured Notes due 2028 $460,000,000 % Senior Notes due 2029 LABL, Inc., a Delaware corporation (the “Issuer”), is offering $750,000,000 in aggregate principal amount of its % Senior Secured Notes due 2028 (the “Secured Notes”) and $460,000,000 in aggregate principal amount of its % Senior Notes due 2029 (the “Unsecured Notes”). The Secured Notes and the Unsecured Notes, together, are referred to as the “Notes,” and each a separate “series” of Notes. The Issuer will pay interest on the Notes on and of each year, commencing on, 2022. The Secured Notes will mature on, 2028 and the Unsecured Notes will mature on, 2029. Interest on the Notes will accrue from, 2021. This offering is part of the financing for the proposed acquisition by certain funds managed by Clayton Dubilier & Rice, LLC (“CD&R”) of MCC (as defined herein) and MCC’s combination with Fortress TopCo, Inc., a Delaware corporation, and its subsidiaries (collectively, “Fort Dearborn”). After consummation of the acquisitions of MCC and Fort Dearborn as set forth in the section entitled “The Transactions” in this offering circular, Labels Buyer, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company (“Buyco”), will own, directly or indirectly, all of the outstanding equity interests of MCC and Fort Dearborn. See “The Transactions” for additional information. The Notes will be redeemable at the Issuer’s option in whole or in part at any time (1) prior to, 2024 at a price equal to 100% of the principal amount thereof, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to but not including the redemption date, plus the applicable “make-whole” premium set forth in this offering circular, and (2) on and after, 2024 at the applicable redemption prices set forth in this offering circular plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to but not including the redemption date. In addition, at any time prior to, 2024, the Issuer may, at its option at any time, apply funds equal to the proceeds of one or more equity offerings to redeem up to 40% of the original aggregate principal amount of each series of Notes (after giving effect to any additional notes) at the applicable redemption prices set forth in this offering circular. Prior to, 2024, during any 12-month period, we may redeem up to 10% of the Secured Notes at 103% of the principal amount thereof, plus accrued and unpaid interest, if any, to but not including the redemption date. We intend to use the proceeds from this offering, together with the other financing sources referred to under “Use of Proceeds,” to fund the consummation of the Transactions (as defined herein). The Secured Notes will be secured by (i) a first priority security interest in the Fixed Asset Collateral (as defined herein), which also secures the Senior ABL Revolving Credit Facility (as defined herein) on a second priority basis and the Senior Cash Flow Credit Facilities and the MCC 2026 Notes (as defined herein) on a pari passu basis and (ii) a second priority security interest in the Current Asset Collateral (as defined herein), which also secures the Senior ABL Revolving Credit Facility on a first priority basis and the Senior Cash Flow Credit Facilities and the MCC 2026 Notes on a second priority basis, pari passu with the Secured Notes. The Secured Notes will be guaranteed, on a secured senior basis, by LABL Acquisition Corporation, a Delaware corporation (“Holdings”) and each of the Issuer’s existing and subsequently acquired or organized direct or indirect wholly-owned U.S. restricted subsidiaries, with certain exceptions (each, a “Subsidiary Guarantor” and collectively with Holdings, the “Guarantors”), including MCC and its existing and subsequently acquired or organized direct or indirect wholly-owned U.S. restricted subsidiaries, with certain exceptions, and, on the date of the consummation of the Fort Dearborn Acquisition, Fort Dearborn and its existing and subsequently acquired or organized direct or indirect wholly-owned U.S. restricted subsidiaries, with certain exceptions. Each Subsidiary Guarantor will also guarantee the Issuer’s obligations under the Senior Cash Flow Credit Facilities, the Senior ABL Revolving Credit Facility and the Unsecured Notes described herein, as well as the MCC Existing Notes (as defined herein) and Holdings will also guarantee the Issuer’s obligations under the Senior Cash Flow Credit Facilities, the Senior ABL Revolving Credit Facility, as well as the MCC 2026 Notes. The guarantees will rank equally in right of payment with all of the existing and future senior indebtedness of each such Guarantor and senior in right of payment to all future subordinated obligations of such Guarantor. The Secured Notes and guarantees will be effectively subordinated to all of the Issuer’s and each Guarantor’s existing and future senior indebtedness under the Senior ABL Revolving Credit Facility to the extent of the value of the Current Asset Collateral securing such indebtedness. The Secured Notes and guarantees will be structurally subordinated to all existing and future indebtedness and other liabilities, including trade payables, of the Issuer and the Subsidiary Guarantors that do not guarantee the Secured Notes (including the non-U.S. subsidiaries that are guarantors or borrowers under the Senior ABL Revolving Credit Facility). The Unsecured Notes will be the Issuer’s unsecured senior indebtedness and will rank equally in right of payment with all of the Issuer’s existing and future senior indebtedness and senior in right of payment to all of its future subordinated obligations. The Unsecured Notes will be guaranteed, on an unsecured senior basis, by each Subsidiary Guarantor. Each Subsidiary Guarantor will also guarantee the Issuer’s obligations under the Senior Cash Flow Credit Facilities, Senior ABL Revolving Credit Facility and Secured Notes described herein, as well as the MCC Existing Notes. The guarantees will rank equally in right of payment with all of the existing and future senior indebtedness of each such Subsidiary Guarantor and senior in right of payment to all future subordinated obligations of such Subsidiary Guarantor. The Unsecured Notes and guarantees will be effectively subordinated to all of the Issuer’s and each Subsidiary Guarantor’s secured indebtedness, including the new Senior Cash Flow Credit Facilities, Senior ABL Revolving Credit Facility, the Secured Notes and the MCC 2026 Notes, to the extent of the value of the assets securing such secured indebtedness. The Unsecured Notes and guarantees will be structurally subordinated to all existing and future indebtedness and other liabilities of the Issuer’s and the Subsidiary Guarantor’s subsidiaries that do not guarantee the Unsecured Notes (including the non-U.S. subsidiaries that are guarantors or borrowers under the Senior ABL Revolving Credit Facility). _Investing in the Notes involves risks. See “Risk Factors” beginning on page 50 of this offering circular._

Subsubsection Text: This offering circular is highly confidential and has been prepared by us solely for use in connection with the proposed offering of the Notes. We reserve the right to withdraw this offering of the i ----- Notes at any time. We and the initial purchasers also reserve the right to reject any offer to purchase, in whole or in part for any reason, or to sell less than all of the Notes offered hereby. This offering circular is personal to the offeree to whom it has been delivered by the initial purchasers and does not constitute an offer to any other person or to the public in general to subscribe for or otherwise acquire the Notes. Distribution of this offering circular to any person other than the offeree and those persons, if any, retained to advise such offeree with respect thereto is unauthorized, and any disclosure of any of its contents, without our prior written consent, is prohibited. Each offeree, by accepting delivery of this offering circular, agrees to the foregoing and to make no photocopies or other duplication of this offering circular, and, if the offeree does not purchase the Notes or the offering is terminated for any reason, to return this offering circular to: Goldman Sachs & Co. LLC, 200 West Street, New York, New York 10282. You acknowledge that: (1) you have been afforded an opportunity to request from us, and to review, and have received, all additional information considered by you to be necessary to verify the accuracy of, or to supplement, the information contained in this offering circular; (2) you have not relied on the initial purchasers or any person affiliated with the initial purchasers in connection with your investigation of the accuracy of such information or your investment decision; (3) this offering circular relates to an offering that is exempt from registration under the Securities Act, and does not comply in important respects with the rules and regulations of the Securities and Exchange Commission (the “SEC”) that would apply to an offering document relating to a public offering of securities; and (4) no person has been authorized to give any information or to make any representation concerning us or our subsidiaries or guarantors or the Notes (other than as contained in this offering circular) and, if given or made, any such other information or representation should not be relied upon as having been authorized by us or the initial purchasers. Laws in certain jurisdictions may restrict the distribution of this offering circular and the offer and sale of the Notes. Persons into whose possession this offering circular or any of the Notes are delivered must inform themselves about, and observe, any such restrictions. Each prospective purchaser of the Notes must comply with all applicable laws and regulations in force in any jurisdiction in which it purchases, offers or sells the Notes or possesses or distributes this offering circular and must obtain any consent, approval or permission required under any regulations in force in any jurisdiction to which it is subject or in which it makes such purchases, offers or sales, and none of us, any of our subsidiaries or guarantors or the initial purchasers shall have any responsibility therefor.

Neither we, the trustee, the initial purchasers, nor any of our or their respective representatives are making any representation to you regarding the legality of an investment by you under applicable legal investment or similar laws. Information contained in this offering circular is not legal, tax or business advice. You should base your decision to invest in the Notes solely on the information contained in this offering circular. Neither we, the trustee, nor the initial purchasers have authorized anyone to provide you with any different information. We, the trustee and the initial purchasers take no responsibility for, and can provide no assurance as to the reliability of, any other information that others may give you. Neither the SEC or any state securities commission nor any other regulatory authority has approved or disapproved of these securities or determined if this offering circular is truthful or complete. Any representation to the contrary is a criminal offense. iii -----

The financial statements included in this offering circular for LABL, Inc. and its consolidated subsidiaries (collectively, “LABL”), including the audited consolidated financial statements and “Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations of LABL,” reflect the consolidated historical results of operations of LABL, Inc. and its consolidated subsidiaries, which will be direct or indirect, wholly-owned subsidiaries of the Issuer following consummation of the MCC Acquisition (as defined herein). The financial statements included in this offering circular for Fort Dearborn Holding Company, Inc. and its consolidated subsidiaries (collectively, “FD”), including the audited consolidated financial statements and “Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations of Fort Dearborn,” reflect the consolidated historical results of operations of Fort Dearborn Holding Company, Inc. and its consolidated subsidiaries, which will be direct or indirect, wholly-owned subsidiaries of the Issuer following consummation of the Fort Dearborn Acquisition (as defined herein). Financial information identified in this offering circular as “pro forma” or “on a pro forma combined basis” has been prepared to give effect to the Transactions in the manner described under “Unaudited Pro Forma Combined Financial Information” and the notes thereto as if the Transactions had occurred on December 31, 2020, in the case of combined statement of operations data, and as of June 30, 2021, in the case of combined balance sheet data. Financial information identified in this offering circular as “combined” or “on a combined basis” reflects an arithmetic combination of LABL and FD data and does not give effect to the Transactions, nor does it reflect certain other adjustments that would be required for unaudited pro forma financial information prepared in accordance with Regulation S-X. Financial information identified in this offering circular as “pro forma” or “on a pro forma combined basis” assumes the concurrent consummation of the MCC Acquisition and the Fort Dearborn Acquisition. However, although we currently expect the MCC Acquisition and the Fort Dearborn Acquisition to close concurrently, the MCC Acquisition is not conditioned upon the Fort Dearborn Acquisition and the Fort Dearborn Acquisition is not conditioned upon the MCC Acquisition. Either the MCC Acquisition or the Fort Dearborn Acquisition could be delayed and may not ultimately be consummated. Some financial information in this offering circular has been rounded and, as a result, the figures shown as totals in this offering circular may vary slightly from the exact arithmetic aggregation of the figures that precede them. iv -----

The market share, industry and other data contained in this offering circular is based on our own estimates, independent industry publications, reports by market research firms, including confidential third-party commissioned studies, or other published and unpublished independent sources. In each case, we believe that they are reasonable estimates, although neither we, the trustee nor the initial purchasers (nor our or their agents) have independently verified market and industry data provided by third parties. Market share, industry and other data is subject to change, however, and cannot always be verified with complete certainty due to limits on the availability and reliability of raw data, the voluntary nature of the data-gathering process and other limitations and uncertainties inherent in any statistical survey of market share. In addition, customer preferences can and do change and the definition of the relevant market is a matter of judgment and analysis. As a result, you should be aware that market share, industry and other data set forth in this offering circular, and estimates and beliefs based on such data, may not be reliable. In addition, certain of these estimates, data, publications, or reports were published before the global COVID-19 pandemic and therefore do not reflect any impact of the COVID-19 pandemic on any specific market or globally.

After giving effect to the Transactions, we will own or have rights to trademarks or service marks that we use in conjunction with the operation of our business. Our trademarks and service marks include our name, logos, registered domain names and certain other marks. Each trademark, trade name or service mark of any other company appearing in this offering circular belongs to its holder. For convenience, the trademarks and service marks referred to in this offering circular are listed without the ®, TM and SM symbols, but we intend to assert, and notify others of, our rights in and to these trademarks and service marks to the fullest extent under applicable law.

When the context so requires, we use the terms “we,” “us” and “our” to refer to the historical businesses of each of MCC and Fort Dearborn, as applicable. viii -----

This offering circular includes presentations of Adjusted EBITDA, Acquisition Adjusted Revenue, Adjusted EBITDA Margin, Acquisition Adjusted Capex, Free Cash Flow, Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA, Pro Forma Adjusted Revenue, Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA Margin, Combined Adjusted EBITDA, Combined Acquisition Adjusted Revenue, Combined Adjusted EBITDA Margin, Combined Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA, Combined Pro Forma Adjusted Revenue and Combined Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA Margin, each of which is a “non-GAAP financial measure” as defined under rules of the SEC. This offering circular may present any of these non-GAAP financial measures on an actual historical basis, a combined historical basis or a pro forma combined basis. These non-GAAP financial measures are not considered a measure of financial performance under U.S. generally accepted accounting principles (“GAAP”), and the items excluded therefrom are significant components in understanding and assessing our financial performance. These non-GAAP financial measures should not be considered in isolation or as an alternative to GAAP measures such as net income (loss), cash flows provided by or used in operating, investing or financing activities or other financial statement data presented in the consolidated financial statements included in this offering circular as an indicator of our financial performance or liquidity. We use these non-GAAP measures in this offering circular to assess the operating results and effectiveness of the historical businesses of MCC and Fort Dearborn as well as the combined company, as the case may be. We present these non-GAAP measures because we believe that investors consider them to be important supplemental measures of performance, and we believe these measures are frequently used by securities analysts, investors and other interested parties in the evaluation of companies in our industry. These non-GAAP measures have limitations as analytical tools and should be evaluated in the context in which they are presented, and you should not consider them in isolation or as substitutes for analysis of the results of MCC, Fort Dearborn and the combined company, as the case may be, as reported under GAAP. For example, these measures: - do not reflect historical cash expenditures, or future requirements, for capital expenditures or contractual commitments; - do not reflect changes in, or cash requirements for, working capital needs; - do not reflect the significant interest expense or the cash requirements necessary to service interest or principal payments on debt; - do not reflect income tax expenses or the cash requirements to pay taxes; and - although depreciation and amortization charges are non-cash charges, the assets being depreciated and amortized will often have to be replaced in the future, and the foregoing metrics do not reflect any cash requirements for such replacements. Other companies in our industry may calculate these non-GAAP measures differently than we do, limiting their usefulness as comparative measures. Because of these limitations, these non-GAAP measures should not be considered as measures of discretionary cash available to us to invest in the growth of our business. We compensate for these limitations by relying primarily on GAAP results and using these non-GAAP measures for supplemental purposes. Additionally, these non-GAAP measures are not alternative measures of financial performance under GAAP and therefore should be considered in conjunction with, and not as alternatives to such GAAP measures. ix ----- Reconciliations of non-GAAP financial measures to the most directly comparable GAAP financial measures for specified periods are set forth in this offering circular under “Summary—Summary Unaudited Pro Forma Combined Financial Information,” “Summary—Summary Historical and Pro Forma Financial Information of LABL” and “Summary—Summary Historical and Pro Forma Financial Information of Fort Dearborn.” Since each of these non-GAAP financial measures is not determined in accordance with GAAP and each is susceptible to varying calculations, each such measure, as presented, may not be comparable to other similarly titled measures of other companies. x -----

Section Title: CAUTIONARY NOTE REGARDING FORWARD LOOKING STATEMENTS
Subsubsection Text: Statements included in this offering circular that are not historical in nature are “forward-looking statements” as defined in the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Forward-looking statements may generally be identified by words such as “believe,” “expect,” “anticipate,” “estimate,” “intend,” “plan,” “seek,” “will,” “should,” “could,” “may,” “aim,” “target,” “potential,” “projects,” “likely,” “continue,” “positioned,” “outlook” and similar expressions. However, the absence of these words or similar expressions does not mean that a statement is not forward-looking. These statements are based upon our current expectations and speak only as of the date of this offering circular. We caution investors that there may be events in the future that we are not able to accurately predict or control, and the information contained in the forward-looking statements is inherently uncertain and subject to a number of risks that could cause actual results to differ materially from those contained in or implied by the forward-looking statements including, without limitation: - our ability to anticipate technology trends and develop and market new products and services; - new developments in packaging; - client concentration and our ability to diversify our customer base; - failure to attract and retain qualified employees; - failure to effectively manage our growth or execute our long-term growth strategy; - failure to grow our business through future acquisitions or strategic transactions; - failure to successfully integrate completed acquisitions; - challenges presented by the COVID-19 pandemic and other pandemics; - raw material cost increases or shortages; - increasing energy or transportation costs; - operational efficiency challenges; - quality control failures resulting in faulty or defective products; - operational disruptions and a lack of redundancy; - the occurrence of natural or man-made disasters; - difficulties in restructuring operations, closing facilities and disposing of assets and facilities; - customer contract arrangements; - cybersecurity threats and interruptions in the proper functioning of our IT systems; - intellectual property infringements or our inability to access third party intellectual property; - litigation and uninsured claims or a rise in insurance premiums; - payment delays and defaults by our customers; - labor disputes, increased labor costs or employee benefit costs; - fluctuations in foreign currency exchange rates; - general economic conditions, including downturns in the geographies and target markets that we serve; - challenges presented by competitive tensions in our industry; - failure to meet legal and regulatory obligations and licensing regulations, and increasing costs of compliance; xi ----- - challenges presented by our international operations, including the United Kingdom’s withdrawal from the European Union; - changes in the foreign regulatory environment regarding privacy and data protection; - weaknesses or deficiencies in our internal, accounting and financial controls; - impairment of our goodwill or intangible assets; - challenges presented by the integration of MCC and Fort Dearborn; - failure to realize growth opportunities, cost savings and synergies from the Transactions; - charges to earnings resulting from the combination of MCC and Fort Dearborn; - conflicts between the interests of CD&R and the interests of the holders of the Notes; - our substantial indebtedness and our ability to incur substantially more indebtedness; - the limitations and restrictions in the agreements governing our indebtedness and our ability to service our indebtedness; - our ability to generate the significant amount of cash needed to service our indebtedness; - the potential that we or our subsidiaries default on our or their obligations to pay our and their indebtedness, including the Notes; - increases in interest rates; - a decline in the market value or liquidity of the Notes as a result of a downgrade, suspension or withdrawal of the rating assigned by a rating agency; - restrictions on your ability to transfer or resell the Notes without registration under applicable securities laws; - the lack of an established trading market for the Notes; - there may not be sufficient Collateral to pay all or any of the Secured Notes; and - risks related to other factors discussed in the offering circular, including those described in “Risk Factors.” These factors are not exhaustive, and new factors may emerge or changes to the foregoing factors may occur that could impact our business. We undertake no obligation to update or revise any forward looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise. xii -----

Subsubsection Title: Pressure Sensitive Labels (47% of combined net revenues)
Subsubsection Text: PSL are multi-layered, self-adhesive labels that differentiate brands and capture consumers’ attention with their dynamic look and flexible applications. We offer customers a full line of PSL products for a wide variety of applications. The label typically consists of four elements—a substrate, which may include paper, foil or plastic; an adhesive, which may be permanent or removable; a release coating; and a backing material to protect the adhesive against premature contact with other surfaces. Innovative features of this product include promotional neckbands, peel-away coupons, re-sealable labels, see-through window graphics, and holographic foil enhancements. PSL is the largest overall prime label technology globally and provides an extremely versatile, low-cost application that is able to produce sharp, bright colors in a wide variety of applications. PSL has historically demonstrated strong growth, which we believe will continue in the future. In addition to our scale in purchasing substrates, we believe our vertically-integrated substrate production capabilities further improve our cost position in PSL relative to our main competitors. These labels are most commonly used in F&B, W&S, and HPC on plastic and glass. Across North America and Europe, we believe we are tied for the number one position in PSL, which continues to represent a significant growth opportunity for us.

Subsubsection Title: Cut & Stack Labels (20% of combined net revenues)
Subsubsection Text: C&S labels are efficiently adhered to containers using an adhesive applied during the labeling process and are also known as “glue applied” labels. C&S is an attractive and cost-effective choice for high volume applications utilizing traditional decorating equipment. C&S can be produced on a wide variety of substrates and accommodate a comprehensive range of embellishments including foil stamping, embossing, metallic and unique varnish finishes. Our innovations within C&S include aluminum foils for premium decoration and anti-tampering as well as environmentally sustainable paper-based solutions. These labels are most commonly used in F&B, W&S, and Specialty (e.g. paints & coatings) end categories on plastic, glass and cans, and we believe we are exposed to end categories within C&S that exhibit above-average growth. We believe we are the largest C&S producer across North America and Europe.

Subsubsection Title: Roll-Fed Labels (9% of combined net revenues)
Subsubsection Text: RF is delivered on a roll without release liners or adhesives. These cost-effective labels are commonly applied to cylindrical product containers. RF offers optimum space for brand presentation. This technology is highly resistant to tearing and moisture, with exceptional brilliance of color at competitive unit costs, and as a result, is a commonly used prime label solution for non-alcoholic drinks. A wide range of special effects such as thermochromic ink and interactive technology are also offered. RF can be applied to any type of container and is most commonly used on plastic bottles and aerosol cans. We believe we are the second largest RF producer across North America and Europe.

Subsubsection Title: In-Mold Labels (8% of combined net revenues)
Subsubsection Text: The IML process applies a label to a plastic container as the container is being formed in the mold cavity. The finished IML product is a finely detailed label that is fused with the plastic container resulting in a high degree of product security and superior durability in a cost-effective manner, in addition to adding marketing value. We offer injection molding, blow molding and thermoforming technologies. 5 ----- Each component of the IML production process requires a special expertise for success. We believe we are advantaged in the industry in that we manufacture IML on rotogravure, flexographic and lithographic printing presses, utilizing proprietary finishing equipment. Technical innovations in this area include the use of peel away IML coupons and scented and holographic labels. These labels are most commonly used in F&B and HPC. We believe we are the largest IML producer across North America and Europe.

Subsubsection Title: Shrink Sleeve Labels (7% of net revenues)
Subsubsection Text: SS is produced in colorful, cutting edge styles and materials. The labels are manufactured as sleeves, slid over glass or plastic bottles and then heated to conform precisely to the contours of the container. This label type is increasingly popular with consumer goods companies such as beverage manufacturers as it allows for product differentiation, as well as having a 360-degree label and tamper resistant features. Demand in other end categories (including F&B and HPC) continues to grow, broadening opportunities for SS as a whole. These labels are most commonly used in beverage and spirits on premium higher-margin products. We believe we are tied as the second largest SS producer across North America and Europe.

Subsubsection Title: Heat Transfer Labels (2% of net revenues)
Subsubsection Text: HT is reverse printed and transferred from a special release liner onto the container using heat and pressure. The labels are a composition of inks and lacquers tailored to the customer’s specific needs. These labels are printed and then shipped to blow molders and/or contract decorators who transfer the labels to the containers. Once applied, the labels are permanently adhered to the container. Therimage is our pioneer heat transfer label technology developed primarily for applications involving plastic containers serving the HPC and F&B end categories. Additionally, our Clear Advantage brand enables us to provide premium graphics on both glass and plastic containers facilitating the highly sought after “no label” look. Our “ink only” and flameless HT technologies have increased our capabilities in this area. We believe we are one of the leading HT providers globally.

We also offer a variety of other labels, complementary products and solutions that help customers address other packaging needs and services. These products include aluminum labels, durables, printed cartons, coupons, instruction sheets and manuals, labeling equipment and Slot-Tickets for the gaming industry, among others. A majority of our customers that purchase our complementary products also purchase labels from us, evidencing the significant cross-sell opportunities of our product offering. 6 ----- 7 ----- consumer to interact with the package. We provide graphically and visually seamless labels that combine brand images and regulatory requirements into an attractive package that interests and appeals to consumers. We believe we are tied for the number one position in prime label manufacturing for HPC across North America and Europe.

Subsubsection Title: Healthcare, Industrial & Other Specialty (10% of combined net revenues)
Subsubsection Text: In addition to the above-mentioned core end categories, we continue to see further growth potential in healthcare, industrial & other specialty end categories. We provide innovative labels for pharmaceutical and promotional products. Additionally, we provide innovative label solutions to industrial products such as paints & coatings, automotive, and agriculture. Scale customers in these end categories leverage our entrenched design-to-ship services and technical resources to support graphics design and help efficiently manage new product introductions. Our customers place a premium on labeling solutions which deliver security, durability and versatility. As with every end category we serve, we focus on delivering high-end labels whose shelf appeal is integral to the products’ marketing strategy while adhering to relevant regulatory requirements. We believe we are the second largest manufacturer of prime labels for Specialty end categories across North America and Europe.

We have a diverse customer base consisting of approximately 16,000 aggregate customers on a gross basis including some of the world’s leading brands. The customer relationships of Multi-Color and Fort Dearborn are highly complementary due to limited customer overlap, having only two shared customers among the respective top 10 customers of each company. Further, the combined company will have no meaningful customer concentration, as our top customer represented only approximately 5% of combined net revenues for the twelve months ended December 31, 2020. Our customers are broadly diversified across a range of consumer-facing end categories (summarized in the preceding section), which have demonstrated long-term resiliency and stable growth. Our differentiated value proposition has resulted in long-tenured relationships with our top ten customers of greater than 25 years on average, and we believe significant opportunities exist to increase share-of-wallet with existing customers while acquiring new customers. 8 ----- 9 -----

We are the leading global manufacturer of prime labels serving a growing blue-chip customer base across a broad range of resilient, consumer-facing end categories worldwide. We believe we have approximately 15% market share of a highly fragmented estimated $16 billion addressable market for prime labels across North America and Europe as of 2019, with approximately two times the scale of the next largest prime label manufacturer and approximately seven times the scale of the third and fourth largest prime label manufacturers, respectively, based on net revenues for 2019. We believe our scale and global footprint, comprehensive product and service offering, well-diversified exposures, long-standing customer relationships and dedicated employees, significant expected cost savings opportunities, meaningful investments in innovation and sustainability solutions, and extensive acquisition track record create competitive advantages relative to other prime label manufacturers. We believe Multi-Color and Fort Dearborn are highly complementary businesses and that the combination is strategically and financially compelling, resulting in a stronger market leader in a highly fragmented industry in which scale provides advantages. The combination will expand the breadth and depth of our comprehensive product portfolio and customer base, across which there is limited overlap, and will improve our diversification across label technologies, end categories, and geographies. We believe the combination will also allow us to realize an estimated $150 million in run-rate cost synergies, further improving our financial profile. The cost synergies are expected to be driven primarily by procurement savings, efficiencies in selling, general, and administrative expense, manufacturing footprint consolidation, and operational improvements including material waste reduction and in-sourcing, among others. In addition to the identified cost synergies, we believe there are several other meaningful operational improvement opportunities, as reflected by approximately $84 million of “in-flight” cost savings initiatives identified by management across the combined business, expected to be driven by cost synergy realization from previously completed acquisitions, continuous improvement and lean manufacturing, procurement, capital productivity, and other identified initiatives. For a further discussion of estimated synergies, see “—Summary Unaudited Pro Forma Combined Financial Information.” 1 ----- 2 ----- 3 ----- 4 -----

Multi-Color was founded in 1916 and began producing paper labels in 1918, marking the beginning of Multi-Color’s leadership in shaping identity and shelf appeal of consumer products. MultiColor has since expanded its portfolio of technologies and customer base to become the pure-play leader in global label solutions supporting a number of the world’s most prominent brands. Multi-Color completed an initial public offering in 1987 and gradually expanded through a combination of organic growth initiatives and acquisitions. In 2017, Multi-Color notably acquired Austrian flexible packaging manufacturer Constantia Flexibles’ labels division, bringing together Constantia Labels’ leading F&B business with Multi-Color’s strong W&S and HPC platforms. In 2019, Multi-Color was taken private by Platinum Equity and proceeded to merge with a subsidiary of W/S Packaging Holdings, Inc. (“WS Packaging”), another label solutions leader within Platinum Equity’s portfolio of companies. Multi-Color has solidified its position as a leading global provider of label solutions delivering strong organic growth and financial performance under the leadership of CEO Nigel Vinecombe and CFO Sharon Birkett. During that time, Multi-Color has successfully executed on a strategy of disciplined topline growth, implementing operating improvements, while enhancing its position in existing and new markets globally. Multi-Color and its management team have a long track-record of expanding through acquisition, having completed and successfully integrated more than 30 acquisitions since 2010.

Fort Dearborn was founded in 1925 with a focus on label production for primarily F&B products. Since its inception, Fort Dearborn has expanded its portfolio of capabilities and markets served through a combination of organic growth initiatives and bolt-on acquisitions, creating a leading prime label manufacturer in North America holding the top position in C&S. In 2006, Fort Dearborn was acquired by Genstar Capital and in 2010, acquired by KRG Capital Partners. Fort Dearborn was acquired by Advent International in 2016, its current majority owner, and under the leadership of Kevin Kwilinski, has successfully delivered profitable growth through a combination of commercial excellence and share gain, operating and margin improvement initiatives, and execution of value-enhancing acquisitions. In March 2021, Fort Dearborn acquired Hammer Packaging, a leading supplier of C&S, IML, PSL, RF and SS labels with more than $100 million of annual net revenue, representing its largest acquisition and resulting in a meaningful cost synergy opportunity.
Our company combines two of the largest manufacturers of prime labels, in an expansive, highly fragmented industry.

We believe Multi-Color and Fort Dearborn are highly complementary businesses and the combination is strategically and financially compelling and will enhance Multi-Color’s position as the leading manufacturer of prime labels globally. Multi-Color and Fort Dearborn are two of the largest manufacturers of prime labels globally in a highly fragmented estimated $16 billion addressable market across North America and Europe as of 2019. We believe the combined company has approximately 15% market share across North America and Europe, with approximately two times the scale of the next largest prime label manufacturer and approximately seven times the scale of the third and fourth largest prime label manufacturers, respectively, based on net revenues for 2019. The combination will expand the breadth and depth of 10 ----- our comprehensive product portfolio and customer base, across which there is limited overlap, and will improve our diversification across label technologies, end categories, and geographies. We believe the combined company will benefit from the advantages to scale in prime label manufacturing, across sourcing, operations, and organic growth and share gain, as evidenced by the long track-record of leading global prime label manufacturers outperforming the broader industry. We believe our scale and global footprint, comprehensive product and service offering, well-diversified exposures, long-standing customer relationships and dedicated employees, significant expected cost savings opportunities, meaningful investments in innovation and sustainability solutions, and extensive acquisition track record create competitive advantages relative to other prime label manufacturers. We intend to apply best practices and leverage our enhanced scale across Multi-Color and Fort Dearborn to drive additional growth and share gain, strengthen operational performance and profitability, and improve capital efficiency. We estimate that the combination will unlock approximately $150 million of run-rate cost synergies. The cost synergies are expected to be driven primarily by procurement savings, efficiencies in selling, general, and administrative expense, manufacturing footprint consolidation, and operational improvements including material waste reduction and in-sourcing, among others. In addition to the identified cost synergies, we believe there are several other meaningful operational improvement opportunities, as reflected by approximately $84 million of “in-flight” cost savings initiatives identified by management across the combined business, expected to be driven by cost synergy realization from previously completed acquisitions, continuous improvement and lean manufacturing, procurement, capital productivity, and other identified initiatives.

The global label industry was estimated to be approximately $41 billion in 2019 and volume is expected to grow at a CAGR of approximately 5% from 2019 to 2024 according to Smithers Pira. Within the broader label industry, we participate in the prime label product category, which consists of labels that are used specifically to identify products on a store shelf or in a retail environment and play a key role in “front-of-line” branding and shelf appeal. Based on findings from a third-party consulting firm and industry research, we estimate a global addressable market for prime labels of approximately $31 billion in 2019, and across North America and Europe, we estimate an addressable market of approximately $16 billion in 2019. We believe prime labels are one of the most important and recognizable components of product identity and are key drivers of consumer preference and loyalty across a wide spectrum of consumerfacing end categories and applications. Prime labels are also used to convey consumer-related information, to provide a means of ensuring product integrity and security, and also to meet regulatory requirements. Prime labels comprise a very small percentage of overall customer product cost, estimated at approximately 1-3% for CPG products. Low cost-to-value, high manufacturing and service complexity, and criticality of supply, coupled with significant portions of revenue under contract, result in enduring customer relationships among leading global prime label manufacturers. Prime label manufacturers benefit from multiple dynamics that have a positive impact on pricing and mix. We believe trends toward increased premiumization, SKU redesign velocity and proliferation, and lead-time and order size variability will continue to manifest in average prime label unit price growth. These positive trends are driven in large part by customers’ marketing departments, which continue to demand more premium labeling solutions, including foils, embossing, and etching, and consistently redesign SKUs, typically 2-3 times per year for seasonal and promotional items, enabling prime label suppliers to drive pricing improvement over the life of a contract. The growth in label redesigns is driven by increased market demand for customization, brand premiumization, sustainable 11 ----- 12 ----- 13 ----- single-use plastics consumption is expected to continue to result in lower prime label demand; however, the combined company is relatively insulated from this headwind as it has lower exposure to single-use plastics than the overall prime label industry and has minimal exposure to clear water, the most impacted product category. Overall, we believe that the accelerating trend toward more sustainable offerings represents limited risk to prime label volume demand, while introducing multiple opportunities for leading prime label suppliers to provide innovative higher-priced products with accretive financial contribution. The global prime labels industry remains highly fragmented, with single plant manufacturers operating in a local market, or multi-plant manufacturers operating in certain regions, constituting the majority of industry capacity, with relatively few global manufacturers. We believe that this highly fragmented market will continue to experience consolidation as suppliers attempt to realize the benefits to scale in prime label manufacturing, across sourcing, operations, and organic growth and share gain, and as global customers continue to consolidate their prime label spend volume across leading global suppliers. We believe these factors have resulted in leading global prime label manufacturers historically taking share vis-à-vis smaller and mid-sized competitors, resulting in long-term abovemarket growth, a trend that we believe will continue to benefit leading global prime label manufacturers. Overall, we believe the global prime label manufacturing industry is highly attractive and that our combined company is well-positioned as the global leader.

Subsubsection Title: Leading Global Prime Label Manufacturer in a Highly Fragmented Industry with Benefits to Scale
Subsubsection Text: On a combined basis, we are the leading global manufacturer of prime labels. We believe that we have approximately 15% market share of a highly fragmented estimated $16 billion addressable market for prime labels across North America and Europe as of 2019, with approximately two times the scale of the next largest prime label manufacturer and approximately seven times the scale of the third and fourth largest prime label manufacturers, respectively, based on net revenues for 2019. Further, we believe that we hold number one or number two positions in each of the key label technologies and end categories we serve across North America and Europe. We believe our leading global position and scale in a highly fragmented industry provide advantages in comparison with smaller national, regional and local competitors. These advantages span procurement and sourcing, operational efficiency, and organic growth and share gain. Our combined scale affords us with advantaged buying power vis-à-vis our base of suppliers and unlocks volume discounts for certain spend categories. We believe our comprehensive combined fleet of label converting technologies will allow us to improve operating efficiency by driving down conversion costs via better alignment of order volume to the optimal equipment, in addition to enabling load-balancing across our combined manufacturing network to improve throughput and utilization. Leading global prime label manufacturers have exhibited a long track-record of above-market growth (approximately two-times the underlying addressable market) and organic share gain. As a result of our combined scale, we believe we will increasingly benefit from our ability to invest in innovation and sustainability solutions, deliver best-in-class lead-times and service levels, and provide value-added services and supply security to our global customer base, which has been and is expected to continue to consolidate spend volume with leading global providers. Because of our competitive advantages relative to our national, regional, and local competitors, we believe we have an opportunity to deliver long-term above-market growth and share gain at attractive levels of profitability. 14 -----

We believe Multi-Color and Fort Dearborn are well-regarded, leading prime label manufacturers, each of which is well positioned to support their global customers, expand share-of-wallet, and gain share in the marketplace while delivering profitable growth. Furthermore, we believe the combination has significant industrial and strategic logic, as it creates a leading global platform with unmatched scale and a well-invested asset base, operating in an industry that exhibits advantages to scale. Our platform consists of state-of-the-art printing presses and a global footprint across 95 strategically located manufacturing facilities that enable us to effectively service customers of all sizes, ranging from the largest multi-national customers in the world to small local accounts. We believe our approximately 12,500 employees globally provide us with unmatched local presence in key geographic regions and that our scaled global platform allows us to remain close to our customers in multiple regions, drive responsive customer service, attain superior lead times and offer increased flexibility and frequent collaboration in R&D and operational efforts. We are able to deliver multiple product types to our customers from multiple facilities, and in some instances, we embed employees in our customers’ facilities to ensure the highest level of customer support. We provide a full complement of label converting technologies including flexographic, lithographic, rotogravure, combination / screen, and digital, plus in-house pre-press services, which we believe differentiate us from our competitors and position us to serve customers across a wide variety of SKUs. Our recent investments in state-of-the-art printing presses and digital printing capabilities have strengthened our leadership in technology and manufacturing capabilities. Since 2018, we have invested over $300 million in capital expenditures to support our growing sales pipeline. We have invested significant resources in commercial excellence and adhere to a targeted growth strategy predicated on capitalizing on significant share-of-wallet opportunities with existing customers, targeting attractive high growth and margin exposures, continuing to broaden our highergrowth emerging market footprint, utilizing sales continuous improvement to better serve regional customers, and leveraging e-commerce and digital printing capabilities to unlock smaller customers via lower cost to serve. We believe our best-in-class commercial systems, including customized lead generation and sales analytics capabilities, represent a key competitive differentiator and will allow us to execute on our targeted growth strategy. In addition to meaningful expected cost synergies, we believe our deep focus on operational excellence and significant identified “in-flight” cost savings, coupled with a well-executed topline growth strategy, will enable us to deliver long-term profitable growth across our global platform and customer base. On a combined basis, we have a track record in recent years of exceeding our targeted acquisition synergy and cost saving targets by greater than 20%, which gives us confidence in our ability to continue to drive identified margin improvements. Furthermore, we believe that on a combined basis we will be well-positioned to execute against a clear set of identified commercial and operational levers to close the meaningful addressable margin and organic growth gap relative to CCL’s prime labels business, which has demonstrated a long-term track record of above-market growth and best-in-class margins, based on our greater combined scale and relative exposures and capabilities.

Subsubsection Title: Well-Diversified Exposures & Long-Standing Relationships with Blue-Chip Customers
Subsubsection Text: We maintain a diverse set of exposures across label technologies, end categories, and geographies. Within each of our end categories and geographies, we service a broad range of customers, many of whom demand multiple label technologies. The combination of Multi-Color and Fort Dearborn will further improve our diversification on a combined basis due to highly complementary 15 ----- 16 ----- Our broad base of approximately 16,000 aggregate customers on a gross basis, ranging from blue-chip multinational companies to smaller local accounts, results in limited customer concentration, as our largest customer represented only approximately 5% of our combined twelve-month period ended December 31, 2020 net revenues. We believe that we are a key link in our customers’ supply chains and brand image, and that our comprehensive product portfolio and expansive global footprint, leadership in digital printing and prototyping, product innovation and sustainability solutions, and valueadded services, provide our customers with a differentiated value proposition, which is further strengthened by our world-class supply chain and effective commercial strategy. We believe our customers highly value our certainty of supply and broad suite of value-added services, which includes advanced material science capabilities, artwork support and graphics management, on-site customer support, and inventory management. These factors support our long-tenured relationships across our customers, averaging more than 25 years across each of Multi-Color’s and Fort Dearborn’s top 10 customers in aggregate.

Subsubsection Title: Significant Margin Opportunity from Cost Synergies & Operating Efficiency Initiatives
Subsubsection Text: We believe the combination of Multi-Color and Fort Dearborn will create significant cost savings opportunities. Specifically, we believe the combination will generate run-rate cost synergies of approximately $150 million, which are expected to be driven primarily by procurement savings, efficiencies in selling, general, and administrative expense, manufacturing footprint consolidation, and operational improvements including material waste reduction and in-sourcing, among others. In addition to the identified cost synergies, we believe there are several other meaningful operational improvement opportunities, as reflected by approximately $84 million of “in-flight” cost savings initiatives identified by Management across the combined business, expected to be driven by cost synergy realization from previously completed acquisitions, continuous improvement and lean manufacturing, procurement, capital productivity, and other identified initiatives. Our history of successful acquisition integration and cost savings realization gives us confidence in our ability to achieve our expected cost synergies and “in-flight” cost savings.

Subsubsection Title: Strong Financial Profile & Cash Flow Generation
Subsubsection Text: We believe we benefit from our differentiated scale and compelling value proposition, which have led to strong operating and financial performance. Since 2019, the year in which Multi-Color completed its merger with W/S Packaging, Multi-Color has demonstrated revenue growth and margin improvement driven by penetration of higher growth geographies and the realization of identified cost synergies and other operational improvements. Over the comparable time period, Fort Dearborn has delivered strong revenue growth, driven by share gain and onboarding of new customer wins, and significant margin expansion from productivity and procurement initiatives, while making meaningful investments in selling, general, and administrative expense. Each company benefits from the contractual pass-through of raw material cost inflation across a majority of net revenues, which results in long-term earnings stability across periods of inflation and deflation. This dynamic is evidenced by $25 million in aggregate Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA contribution from executed pricing actions net of cost inflation as of June 30, 2021 across Multi-Color and Fort Dearborn. We believe the combination of Multi-Color and Fort Dearborn and the associated cost synergy opportunities, in addition to “in-flight” cost savings, will further improve our combined financial profile, and we have a demonstrated track record of exceeding our cost synergy and savings targets historically. On a combined basis, we have demonstrated strong free cash flow conversion despite meaningful historical investments to support future growth. We estimate that maintenance capital expenditures will only amount to approximately 1-2% of net revenues per annum and believe that our 17 ----- growth and productivity capital expenditures exhibit attractive return on capital profiles. In addition to significant estimated cost synergies resulting from the combination, we expect to benefit from opportunities to reduce capital intensity across the combined network through fixed asset efficiency and working capital improvements.

Subsubsection Title: Experienced Management Team within the Label Industry
Subsubsection Text: We are led by an experienced senior management team with an average of over 26 years of relevant industry experience that is focused on driving continued growth, profitability, and cash flow generation, in addition to successfully integrating the combined business and realizing the significant cost synergy and “in-flight” cost savings opportunities identified. Our executive team is led by President and CEO, Kevin Kwilinski, who has over 29 years of relevant industry experience and has successfully run Fort Dearborn since 2017 delivering significant share gain and margin improvement. Our executive leadership is supported by a deep bench of functional talent across our business units, including Sharon Birkett, who will serve as our CFO, a role she has held at Multi-Color since 2010. Given the scale and industry leadership of both Multi-Color and Fort Dearborn, we believe that both organizations bring a strong pool of business unit and functional talent. The combination provides opportunities to leverage top talent from both organizations and for career progression and individual development at all levels of the organization. On a combined basis, the team has successfully completed and integrated over 30 acquisitions since 2010 with a strong track record of exceeding cost synergy targets.

Subsubsection Title: Leverage Global Leadership Position to Realize Benefits to Scale
Subsubsection Text: We intend to leverage our global leadership position and relative market share to capitalize on the benefits to scale in label manufacturing. These advantages span procurement and sourcing, operational efficiency, and organic growth and share gain. We plan to utilize our combined purchasing scale to afford us with advantageous buying power vis-à-vis our base of suppliers and unlock volume discounts for certain spend categories. Enabled by our comprehensive combined fleet of label converting technologies, we plan to improve operating efficiency by driving down conversion costs via better alignment of order volume to the optimal equipment, in addition to improving load-balancing across our combined manufacturing network to drive higher throughput and utilization. Historically, leading global prime label manufacturers have exhibited a long track-record of above-market growth and organic share gain. As a result of our combined scale, we intend to continue to gain organic share and differentiate compared to national, regional, and local competitors by investing in innovation and sustainability solutions, delivering what we believe to be best-in-class lead-times and service levels, and providing value-added services and supply security to our global customer base, which has been and is expected to continue to consolidate spend volume with leading global providers.

We intend to continue to execute our effective growth strategy to increase our share across end categories, customers, and geographies. We plan to leverage our long-tenured relationships with existing customers to drive share-of-wallet gains to capitalize on meaningful identified white-space 18 ----- opportunities with key accounts. Historically, Multi-Color has delivered increased growth through product innovation and penetration of higher growth emerging market geographies, and Fort Dearborn has a demonstrated track record of expansion in higher growth exposures, including condiments, sauces and pet food within the broader F&B end category. We plan to continue to focus our sales and business development efforts on the most attractive high growth and margin exposures, in which we believe the combined company’s value proposition is a significant differentiator. Identified focus areas include healthcare, e-commerce, and global HPC, in addition to continuing to penetrate higher growth emerging market geographies. To better serve key regional and smaller customers, we intend to execute against identified sales continuous improvement initiatives and leverage our capabilities in digital printing and e-commerce to lower our cost to serve. Fort Dearborn’s significant recent customer wins, for which contracts and capacity are in place and onboarding has begun, exemplify the organic growth and share gain potential of the combined company.

Subsubsection Title: Invest in Innovation, Technology & Sustainability Solutions
Subsubsection Text: We intend to continue to invest significant resources in innovation, technology, and sustainability offerings, which we believe are highly valued by our customers and will allow us to continue to differentiate and drive profitable growth over the long-term. We have built a strong culture of innovation with multiple R&D and prototyping centers that support customers globally. We generated approximately $170 million, over the LTM Period, of combined digital sales utilizing one of the largest fleets of digital presses globally, including 68 digital presses across 36 facilities in 15 countries. Our combined digital fleet enables us to realize profitability at short run sizes and unlock smaller, high growth and margin customers. We plan to build upon our track record of success in innovation and digital printing to further expand our capabilities in these areas. Additionally, we believe label manufacturers play a key role in enabling packaging recyclability, and we intend to continue to grow our portfolio of innovative solutions, many of which are recognized by the Association of Plastic Recyclers and similar organizations abroad, to improve packaging recycling rates and sustainability. We also plan to continue executing on our systematic approach to light-weighting labels to reduce material content, reducing material waste, and improving energy efficiency.

We intend to continue to supplement organic growth with opportunistic acquisitions at attractive valuations in both existing and new markets, leveraging our proven consolidation platform and track record of successfully integrating acquisitions, realizing cost synergies, and better serve our customers. We believe we are well-positioned to capitalize on numerous synergistic global acquisition opportunities, and plan to employ a disciplined approach focused on targets with clear strategic and financial logic, many of which are expected to be balance sheet enhancing. For example, Multi-Color’s recently closed acquisition of Hexagon and signed definitive agreement to acquire Skanem, demonstrate the meaningful global M&A opportunity, see “—Recent Developments.”

Subsubsection Title: Drive Earnings Growth Through Realization of Cost Synergies and “In-Flight” Cost Savings
Subsubsection Text: We believe the combination of Multi-Color and Fort Dearborn will generate approximately $150 million of cost synergy opportunities in addition to “in-flight” cost savings at each company. The cost synergies are expected to be driven primarily by procurement savings, efficiencies in selling, general, and administrative expense, manufacturing footprint consolidation, and operational improvements including material waste reduction and in-sourcing, among others. In addition to the identified cost synergies, we believe there are several other meaningful operational improvement opportunities, as reflected by approximately $84 million of “in-flight” cost savings initiatives identified by 19 ----- management across the combined business, expected to be driven by cost synergy realization from previously completed acquisitions, continuous improvement and lean manufacturing, procurement, capital productivity, and other identified initiatives. Our history of successful acquisition integration and cost savings realization gives us confidence in our ability to achieve our expected cost synergies and “in-flight” cost savings. See “Risk Factors—Risks Related to the Transactions—We may not realize the anticipated cost synergies and growth opportunities from the Transactions.”

Subsubsection Title: Continue to Focus on Operational Excellence
Subsubsection Text: We intend to continue to leverage our culture of operational excellence to drive ongoing continuous improvement, resulting in sustainable margin expansion, robust organic sales growth, and improved capital efficiency and cash flow generation. By combining Multi-Color and Fort Dearborn, we expect to benefit from significant best-practice sharing across the combined company. Based on our greater combined scale and relative exposures and capabilities, we believe that on a combined basis we will be well-positioned to execute against a clear set of identified commercial and operational levers to close the meaningful addressable margin and organic growth gap relative to CCL Industries’ prime labels business, which has demonstrated a long-term track record of above-market growth and best-in-class margins.
We plan to further strengthen our competitive positioning and will pursue profitable growth, margin expansion, and cash flow generation through our strategic initiatives, including:

On July 1, 2021, Multi-Color announced it had entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Hexagon, a leading manufacturer of prime labels in Australia and New Zealand with $133 million in net revenues and $32 million in Adjusted EBITDA for the LTM Period. Hexagon specializes in manufacturing high-margin PSL, in addition to producing SS labels and linerless wraps, utilizing specialized narrow-web label converting capabilities. We believe Hexagon holds the #1 position in New Zealand and is complemented by a high-growth platform in Australia, serving a broad range of end categories including F&B, W&S, and Specialty (primarily healthcare). We believe Hexagon is highly complementary to Multi-Color, and combining the companies creates the clear market leader in Australia and New Zealand and provides a meaningful cost synergy opportunity. The acquisition of Hexagon closed on September 30, 2021. On September 30, 2021, Multi-Color also announced it had entered into a definitive agreement to acquire Skanem. Founded in 1905 and headquartered in Stavanger, Norway, Skanem is a leading provider of prime labels in Northern Europe and Thailand with $123 million in net revenues and $17 million in Adjusted EBITDA for the LTM Period. Skanem specializes in PSL, which represent the vast majority of net revenues, across a full range of converting technologies. We believe Skanem holds the #1 position in Northern Europe, is complemented by a high-growth platform in Southeast Asia, and further benefits from its low-cost manufacturing platform in Poland, which serves Europe more broadly. Skanem’s customers span a broad range of end categories including HPC, F&B, and Specialty, and we believe Skanem’s strong HPC position in Europe is highly complementary to Multi-Color’s strong presence and customer base in HPC in North America. Further, Skanem’s Thailand operation provides Multi-Color’s existing presence in the region with additional scale in this sizeable and growing developing market, and we believe that overall, there is a meaningful cost synergy opportunity from the combination. The transaction is expected to close during the fourth quarter of 2021. However, there is no guarantee that this transaction will close within this timeframe or at all. 20 ----- 21 ----- year due to isolated operating inefficiencies resulting from COVID-related absenteeism and prior consolidation of select plants, both of which are expected to be temporary and are being mitigated with plans in place. European beverage categories and IML are experiencing softness relative to strong demand in the comparable prior year period. Developing markets continue to exhibit strong revenue growth, partially offset by discrete, unforeseen factors, including COVID-related lockdowns in Asia and restricted trade into China. FX translation is expected to be favorable. For the three-month period ended September 30, 2021, Multi-Color Adjusted EBITDA is expected to decline relative to the three months ended September 30, 2020 primarily driven by transitory issues. Significant raw material inflation has impacted earnings in the quarter as the pass-through of price increases has temporarily lagged inflation. This dynamic is expected to be transitory given contractual pass-through pricing mechanisms inherent to our business model, and we expect to more than recover cost inflation as evidenced by approximately $8 million of Pro Forma Adjusted EBITDA contribution from pricing execution net of cost inflation expected as of the LTM Period, which we expect to increase for the twelve-month period ended September 30, 2021. Higher labor costs are also anticipated to pressure results primarily due to the temporary duplication of resources related to isolated prior plant closures and inefficiencies due to COVID-induced challenges related to recruitment, retention and training in the U.S., Europe and Asia, the latter of which have impacted global manufacturers more broadly. Additionally, temporary destocking of European beverage inventories and less favorable IML mix are expected to contribute to lower earnings. In North America, key leading indicators of underlying operating performance, including backlogs and on-time delivery rates, are trending favorably across the isolated plants that have been most impacted by operating inefficiencies as a result of COVID and prior plant closures. We believe this observed improvement, coupled with strong pricing execution, will result in improved earnings momentum, given underlying topline growth.

For the three-months period ended September 30, 2021, Fort Dearborn Acquisition Adjusted Revenue is expected to be approximately up 3% to up 8% relative to the three months ended September 30, 2020. This strong expected performance is mainly driven by the successful onboarding of identified new customer wins, primarily in Shrink Sleeve and Roll-Fed, and strong pricing execution, which are expected to be partially offset by declines in C&S related to certain food categories that exhibited COVID-related demand increases in the prior year, as well as headwinds from destocking and mix. Relative to pre-COVID levels in 2019, demand for certain end categories positively impacted by COVID remains higher to-date, which we believe will be sustained by shifts in consumer purchasing behavior. For the three-month period ended September 30, 2021, Fort Dearborn Adjusted EBITDA is expected to demonstrate strong growth relative to the three months ended September 30, 2020. Continued strong realization of “in-flight” cost savings initiatives and synergies from prior M&A in addition to contribution from onboarding of profitable new customer wins are expected to be partially offset by the impact of destocking and mix. Price increases are expected to continue to more than offset inflation with additional pricing contribution anticipated going forward.

On July 1, 2021, LABL Holdings entered into the MCC Merger Agreement with Buyco, Merger Sub and Platinum. Under the terms of the MCC Merger Agreement, Merger Sub will be merged with and into LABL Holdings, with LABL Holdings being the surviving corporation. 22 ----- Simultaneously on July 1, 2021, Buyco entered into the Fort Dearborn Acquisition Agreement with Fortress TopCo and Fortress Parent. Under the terms of the Fort Dearborn Acquisition Agreement, Buyco will, directly or indirectly, acquire all of the issued and outstanding capital stock of Fortress TopCo. The following transactions are expected to occur in connection with the MCC Acquisition, the Fort Dearborn Acquisition and the offering and the sale of the Notes, which we refer to collectively as the “Transactions”: - the CD&R Funds will cause approximately $1,350.0 million of cash (subject to change depending on a number of factors, including (i) actual working capital at closing of the Transactions, (ii) availability under the Senior ABL Revolving Credit Facility at closing of the Transactions and (iii) drawings, if any, under the Senior ABL Revolving Credit Facility at closing of the Transactions in accordance with the terms of the ABL Credit Agreement) to be contributed, directly or indirectly, to Buyco in exchange for membership interests in Buyco, and Buyco will, in turn, cause such funds to be contributed to Merger Sub to fund a portion of the cash consideration of the MCC Acquisition or to be directly or indirectly contributed to the Issuer; - the Issuer will enter into the Senior Secured Credit Facilities, comprised of: - a seven-year senior secured term loan facility in an aggregate principal amount of up to $1,971.8 million (to be allocated between a U.S. dollar denominated tranche and a Euro denominated tranche) (as further described in “Description of Other Indebtedness—Senior Cash Flow Credit Facilities”); - a five-year senior secured cash flow revolving credit facility in an aggregate principal amount of up to $200.0 million (as further described in “Description of Other Indebtedness—Senior Cash Flow Credit Facilities”); and - a five-year senior secured asset-based loan facility in an aggregate principal amount of up to $500.0 million, and subject to a borrowing base (as further described in “Description of Other Indebtedness—Senior ABL Revolving Credit Facility”). - the Issuer will issue $1,210.0 million in aggregate principal amount of the Notes offered hereby; - at the closing of the MCC Acquisition, Buyco will, directly or indirectly, acquire all of the outstanding equity interests of MCC; - following the closing of the MCC Acquisition, Buyco will assign the Fort Dearborn Acquisition Agreement to the Issuer; - at the closing of the Fort Dearborn Acquisition, the Issuer will acquire all of the outstanding equity interests of Fort Dearborn; and - the net proceeds of the CD&R Equity Investment, the offering of the Notes and the borrowings under the Senior Secured Credit Facilities will be used to: - fund the cash consideration payable in connection with the Transactions; - repay in full the Existing Indebtedness (including accrued and unpaid interest and related prepayment penalties), which represented an aggregate amount of $2,045.6 million as of June 30, 2021, less unrestricted cash of $48.2 million; and - pay transaction-related fees, expenses and other payments. Although we currently expect the MCC Acquisition and the Fort Dearborn Acquisition to close concurrently, the Fort Dearborn Acquisition is not conditioned on the MCC Acquisition and the MCC Acquisition is not conditioned on the Fort Dearborn Acquisition. As of the date of this offering circular, all governmental approvals for the consummation of the MCC Acquisition and the Fort Dearborn Acquisition have been obtained or the statutory antitrust review periods in the applicable jurisdictions 23 ----- 24 ----- Transactions and (iii) drawings, if any, under the Senior ABL Revolving Credit Facility at closing of the Transactions in accordance with the terms of the ABL Credit Agreement. See “The Transactions” for additional information. (e) Represents the cash consideration payable in connection with the MCC Acquisition to Platinum immediately prior to the MCC Acquisition pursuant to the MCC Merger Agreement, the cash consideration payable in connection with the Fort Dearborn Acquisition to Fortress Parent, LP immediately prior to the Fort Dearborn Acquisition pursuant to the Fort Dearborn Acquisition Agreement and the cash consideration which is reserved to fund the Other Transactions. Excludes deferred consideration and other purchase price adjustments. Amounts are net of any reimbursed fees and certain other related costs included in the combined purchase price. Includes $1,253.2 million of Existing MCC Indebtedness to be repaid at closing, net of the MCC Existing Notes, capital leases and other debt rolled over at closing. Includes $781.4 million of Existing Fort Dearborn Indebtedness to be repaid at closing. (f) Represents estimated financing fees and expenses, initial purchasers’ discounts, original issue discount with respect to the Senior Term Loan Facility and certain other advisory fees and transaction costs associated with the Transactions.

LABL, Inc., a Delaware corporation, is the issuer of the Notes offered hereby and, after giving effect to the Transactions, will be the direct or indirect parent of MCC and Fort Dearborn. Our principal executive offices will be located at 4053 Clough Woods Dr. Batavia, Ohio 45103. Our telephone number will be (513) 381-1480.

Founded in 1978, Clayton, Dubilier & Rice is a private investment firm with a strategy predicated on building stronger, more profitable businesses.
